Reason: The configuration 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly impacts the system performance by setting a threshold for logging GC pauses at WARN level. If the GC pauses exceed the specified threshold, they will be logged, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the configuration involves performance-related operations related to monitoring and logging GC pauses, which are time-expensive and memory-expensive, contributing to its performance sensitivity.
